item.title: Melanie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "If it could only be like this always – always summer, always alone, the fruit always ripe and Aloysius in a good temper..." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Melanie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "I should like to bury something precious in every place where I've been happy and then, when I'm old and ugly and miserable, I could come back and dig it up and remember." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker
